result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric D. Slocum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Marathon County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Maintain FTE/schooling or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 9 hours community service per week.
Absolute sobriety from controlled substances unless prescribed and only within that prescribed amount.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Counseling as recommended.  AODA and follow up.  

DNA sample.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination.
Absolute Sobriety from Alcohol and Controlled Substances.

DNA sample.

Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended.

AODA and Follow up.

Payment of financial obligations.

PLEA HEARING IN 18CF833:

PLEA: 
18CF833:
Ct. 1 (Possess w/Intent-Amphetamine (>3-10g)-Repeater)>> GUILTY. 
Ct. 3 (Encouraging Parole/Probation Violation-Repeater)>> GUILTY.

Defendant makes statement.

COURT ORDERS: 

18CF833:
Ct. 1 (Possess w/Intent-Amphetamine (>3-10g)-Repeater)>> 6 Years WSPS, 3 Years IC and 3 Years ES, Concurrent to Ct. 3 and 17CF137, 15CF633, 15CF366. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, AODA and Follow up, Absolute Sobriety from Alcohol and Controlled Substances, Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge, DNA Sample. Court finds Defendant is eligible for SAP and CIP Programming. Court finds 310 Days Credit. 

Ct. 3 (Encouraging Parole/Probation Violation-Repeater)>> 2 Years WSPS, 1 Years IC and 1 Years ES, Concurrent to Ct. 1 and 17CF137, 15CF633, 15CF366. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, AODA and Follow up, Absolute Sobriety from Alcohol and Controlled Substances, Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge, DNA Sample. Court finds Defendant is eligible for SAP and CIP Programming. Court finds 310 Days Credit. 


SENTENCING HEARING ON REVOCATION:

Ct. 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine-Repeater)>> 3.5 Years WSPS, 1.5 Years IC and 2 Years ES, Concurrent to Ct. 3 and 18CF833, 15CF633, 15CF366. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, AODA and Follow up, Absolute Sobriety from Alcohol and Controlled Substances, Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge, DNA Sample. Court finds Defendant is eligible for SAP and CIP Programming. Court finds 325 Days Credit. 

15CF633:
Ct. 1 (BJ-Felony)>> 3.5 Years WSPS, 1.5 Years IC and 2 Years ES, Concurrent to 17CF137, 18CF833, 15CF366. COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS:

On Misd. charges:  SWH.  Probation for 2 years, concurent. Amend bond in all 3 cases to delete the day report.
